conclusion: Determine the time for the laser beam to reach a position where light emerges from arc surface ABC.
Laser beam starts at point A and moves towards point C at constant speed v.
Laser beam refracts entering the brick and emerges from arc surface ABC.
Angle of incidence must be less than critical angle θc for light to emerge.
Critical angle θc is given by sin θc = 1/n.
Total internal reflection occurs if angle of incidence is greater than θc.
Laser beam at distance x from A at time t, so x = vt.
Angle of incidence θi depends on laser beam position.
Angle of incidence θi is related to position x by θi = arcsin(x/r).
For light to emerge, θi < θc, implying x < r/n.
Time t when laser reaches x = r/n is t = r/(nv).
Moment when light emerges from arc surface ABC is r/(nv).
